Issues.Title: Allow input colors on contenteditable
Issues.Body:
This is a **bugfix**. ### Proposed solution [Input color classes](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/input/#colors) like `is-danger` should also apply to [contenteditable](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/contenteditable) elements, which are functionally similar to inputs and textareas. It is currently global but I could put it under a new class `.contenteditable` if you prefer. This solution only applies the border color and does not assume anything else about how the contenteditable is styled. ### Tradeoffs It is possible but unlikely that existing developers would be using `is-danger` on a `contenteditable` with different semantics. ### Testing Done Tested: ```html
Hello
``` ### Changelog updated? I can add a changelog and update documentation upon request.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Allow input colors on contenteditable" (#3233)

Issues.Title: Feature request: basic styles mode
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview

Addition of a mode (body class switch?) whereby basic browser defaults are not neutralized.

### Description

Understand many, perhaps most, want to use Bulma to start a project from a neutral, reset, full control state whereby all margins, font sizes and other simple basics - mostly default browser styles - are neutralized. Then use the declarative class approach.

**_Some may not want that_**. If you just want to throw Bulma at a single/simple page, for example, and get the basics of a page that may benefit from simplicity of some browser defaults whilst also allowing the addition of Bulma features later, such as notifications for one example, would it be possible to provide a variation of the default mode for such use cases?

### Steps to Reproduce

Take the basic https://bulma.io/documentation/overview/start/#starter-template

Add significant paragraphs, headings to generate a very simple page without any header, sidebar or other layout. Perhaps using lorum ipsum.

Remove arguably excess / unnecessary classes such as `h1 class=title`, `h2 class=subtitle`.

### Expected behavior

Basic browser default heading font styles - size, weight, margins - are maintained instead of an unreadable state.

### Actual behavior

Headings are indistinguishable from paragraph text.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: basic styles mode" (#3232)

Issues.Title: Use single file for extends
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **bugfix**.

### Proposed solution

Instead of importing the `mixins` file which also includes all Sass placeholders, move all placeholders to its own `extends` file, and import that file only once.

Also, all references to the `.sass` file extension have been removed, since they're unnecessary when there's no ambiguity between a `.sass` file or a `.scss` file.

### Tradeoffs

If you imported `mixins` to get the placeholders, you need to include `extends` instead.
If you imported using `.sass`, you'll need to remove it now.

### Testing Done

Imported Bulma in custom setups. Still works.

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use single file for extends" (#3216)

Issues.Title: Do not override is-rounded with button-small. Fixes #3163.
Issues.Body:
This is a bugfix for #3163. ### Proposed solution `button-small` currently assumes the button is not rounded and overrides its border-radius from `$radius` to `$radius-small`. This is not valid however if `is-rounded` is applied to the button. This PR adds `&:not(.is-rounded)` to avoid this. This solution is preferable to #3164 which uses `!important`. ### Tradeoffs None ### Testing Done Tested with the following code: ```html

This button should be small and rounded:

``` Bulma `v0.9.1` incorrectly renders the button not rounded. Test and confirmed that this PR causes the button to be correctly rendered small and rounded. ### Changelog updated? No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Do not override is-rounded with button-small. Fixes #3163." (#3208)

2. Have a look at line 7 of the example's source code:

```html
<a role="button" class="navbar-burger burger" aria-label="menu" aria-expanded="false" data-target="navbarBasicExample">
```

### Expected behavior

The hamburger button should not contain CSS class `burger`.

### Actual behavior

That button contains CSS class `burger` which seems to have no effect at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Complete basic navbar example uses superfluous CSS class" (#3211)
